annotation.TEXT: And, the RNG decided on Sophia III. That's cool, because I do have a weapon that can destroy Bullet Bills if needed.
That's it for that goofy-looking Bowser, which was actually a Hammer Bro. in disguise.
Whoops! Didn't mean to fall there. I could wait for my Hover to refill, but it'll be faster just to wall-climb up the staircase.
Actually, there's something I've been wondering, and this could be big... Can a kicked shell take out these Bullet Bills?
...Pfft, hahahahaha!!! ...Oh, man. I'm sorry, but that Bowser just looks so goofy to me for some reason! This is just hilarious!
I honestly spent most of this battle laughing out loud!
Yep! Hey, bullets, get outta the way!
Aw, what? The victory music got cut off! Oh, well. Now, for the next level, let's go with a character that can actually swim. There was a vote for Peach, one of Luigi's skins, so...
Alright, we've made it to world 8! So, which characters should I use? I'll probably want a "Quick" character for 8-1, and something AWESOME for 8-4 might be a good idea...
Also, I notice that this row of blocks with the power up here is one space lower than usual, but that might've been intentional to help some characters out.
Alright, now for the next level, I gotta go with someone that got more than 1 vote. Link got 2 votes, including a vote for BS Zelda Link, so...
Oh, the victory music wasn't cut off that time. Okay, now it's gonna be a Mega Man skin for 7-4, and I believe I'll go with Cut Man.
Oh, I am so going to cut Bowser on the dotted line!
Yikes, that was close.
Alt. skin votes included Cut Man/Ice Man/Rokko Chan (Mega Man), Quick Man (Bass), BS Zelda Link, and Peach (Luigi).
I've rescued a Met, and the text here is kind of hard to read. It says: "Thank you Cut Man! But Dr. Light is in another castle!"
There is a sort of suction effect while I'm over a pit by the way, just like in the original SMB, so I've gotta paddle harder.
Oh, what the heck? It's not letting me walk to the right off this edge here! Okay, screw those six coins. I'm thinking there may be a glitch with the suction effect now...
Whoa, how'd I end up climbing there? That was weird. Whatever.
Oh, man! I gotta see that charge shot again! It's a giant pair of snipping scissors! That's so awesome! (But, is it as awesome as the AWESOME SPREAD GUN?)
I'm still probably not gonna use the wall and ceiling climbing abilities much, because they're usually not that important in the SMB world, and Hover is plenty good in most situations.
Umm... I hope I can make this jump.
Umm... Actually, I don't think there is a Link for BS Zelda. There's Zelda, Hero, and Heroine, but no Link. Maybe you meant either the Hero or Heroine...
Votes for Google to change the comment system back: At least 200,631.
Yeah, there's pickups being dropped there, but I'm not gonna risk going for them. They're not that vital.
Hello, and welcome back to SMB Crossover! Votes are shown above as usual.
Too bad I don't have any fireballs...
Argh! I was expecting to move to the right faster there.
Okay, we should be good now.
Too bad there's no bricks or enemies (besides Bowser) in 7-4 to break.
To be continued...
Oh, man. These controls are so loose. I don't think the loose controls of Luigi are supposed to affect swimming controls...
Yeah, Peach's trademark hovering ability is not present in SMB Crossover. I just tried it as I climbed the stairs there.
Speaking of time...
Ack! I hate how the cheepos can just ambush you like that, giving you almost no time to react! I really hope I don't die here...
Okay, Bloopers, you can go away now...
What is that? A more powerful sword? Maybe it's the Magical/Master Sword?
This multi-coin block is still in the right spot, right?
Alright, let's switch to the NES Peach.
At least my sword can take them out in one shot.
Nice!
The Hover ability is especially nice because I don't need to seek out pickups to refill it like in the original Blaster Master.
Oh, man. I don't want to waste time on these Birdos, so I'm just gonna homing missile them.
Alright, I assume all of the paths are properly working here. Now for boss time, against...
Yay, another 1â™¥P that I probably won't need. (I'm 100% sure that was a heart.)
So, place your votes for the characters you think I should use for world 8, and we'll find out what goes down next time, on the finale of the original SMB levels!
Now, just like 2-3, this level has those flying cheepos that we love to hate.
Okay, I avoided dying there this time.
Also, is it just me, or are those Bloopers moving faster than I'm used to?
Demo count: 6
Oh, yeah. And there's koopas in this level too.
Mega Man wins, but I'm going to save him for 7-4, so let's go with random now.
I like breaking bricks in search of more pickups, but I don't want to waste too much time doing so.
Interestingly, the game won't let me fire any regular shots until my charged-up big scissors have left the screen. But, otherwise, I can have three regular shots on screen at once.
Yeah, we're okay when it comes to making jumps here.
If I take all the paths that I believe are correct and don't end up repeating a section, I'll just assume they're all working correctly.
Maybe shooting those bricks like that wasn't such a good idea... Oh, well. Whatever.
Okay, I'm sure we all get it by now, so I'm not gonna spend all day here farming for lives that I most likely won't need.
Oh, yes it can! You know what this means! Easy life farming!
Oh, another upgrade. I do believe this one would be "Wall 2", which means, unless there's a door that I'll need the "Key" upgrade to unlock (I doubt it), that should be every upgrade.
Oh, but there's two versions, the NES one and the SNES one. I've done the equivalent of flipping a coin, and decided to go with the SNES one.
Ah, so when I've got all the upgrades, power up blocks just start giving me weapon pickups I guess.
Yes! Another hat trick of getting 5000 with 6 fireworks!

Now, in the original SMB, while the random bullets in 5-3 could be shell-killed, the bullets that came out of cannons like these could not, oddly enough. However, seeing how the "kick the turtle on stairs for 1-ups" trick doesn't work in SMB Crossover, I think this is an acceptable substitute.
I think I'll go with the Heroine (Does she have an actual name?), since we need more female protagonists.
Now, just like 4-4, this level has correct and incorrect paths in it. I'm not gonna bother testing the wrong paths this time.
